info.title: Customer Return (A2X)
info.description:
You can use this service to integrate external applications with customer return processing. In every API call, you can make use of the following operations:
 - You can retrieve customer returns. Apply any of the filters provided or retrieve all existing data.
 - You can create customer returns. Note that you must use “deep insert” requests (a header plus at least one of the following entities: header partner, header pricing element, item, item partner, and item pricing element). You cannot create headers without including any related entities.
 - You can create items for existing customer returns. Note that you must use “deep insert” requests (an item plus at least one of the following entities: item partner and item pricing element). You cannot create items without including any related entities.
 - For existing customer returns, you can update the header, header partner, header pricing element, item, item partner, and item pricing element.
 - For existing customer returns, you can delete the header, header partner, header pricing element, item, item partner, and item pricing element.
 - You can approve or reject existing accelerated returns.

Note: Certain elements and entities can only be used if you activate the business function ISR_RETAILSYSTEM. For more information, see Business Documentation.

x-sap-shortText: Create, read, update, and delete customer returns using this synchronous inbound service

get.summary: Reads all customer return headers.
get.description: Reads the header data of all customer returns in the system.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Sorting](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=65)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Creates one or more customer return headers.
post.description: Creates customer return headers by using deep insert requests. This means that consumers must create a header together with at least one of the following entities: header partner, header pricing element, item, item partner, and item pricing element.

get.summary: Reads the header of a specific customer return.
get.description: Reads the header data of a specific customer return, which the consumer specifies by passing the customer return number.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.summary: Updates the header of a specific customer return.
patch.description: Updates the header data of a specific customer return, which the consumer specifies by passing the customer return number.

delete.description: Deletes a specific customer return, which the consumer specifies by passing the customer return number. Deleting a header also deletes all related entities such as business partners, pricing elements, items, and so on.

get.summary: Reads all items of a specific customer return.
get.description: Reads all item data of a specific customer return, which the consumer specifies by passing the customer return number.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Sorting](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=65)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Creates one or more items for a specific customer return.
post.description: Creates item data for a specific customer return, which the consumer specifies by passing the customer return number.

post.summary: Creates one or more customer return items.
post.description: Creates items for existing customer returns by using deep insert requests. This means that consumers must create an item together with at least one of the following entities: item partner and item pricing element. Consumers must specify the customer return number in the payload.

get.summary: Reads a specific customer return item.
get.description: Reads the data of a specific customer return item, which the consumer specifies by passing the customer return number and item number.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.summary: Update a specific customer return item.
patch.description: Updates the data of a specific customer return item, which the consumer specifies by passing the customer return number and item number.

delete.summary: Deletes a specific customer return item.
delete.description: Deletes the data of a specific customer return item, which the consumer specifies by passing the customer return number and item number. Deleting an item also deletes all related entities such as item partner, item pricing element, and so on.

get.summary: Reads the customer return header for a specific item.
get.description: Reads customer return header fields for a specific item. Consumer must pass the following key fields: customer return number and item number.

parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

parameters.description: Item number of the SD document

post.summary: Creates one or more value-added services for a specific customer return item.
post.description: Creates value-added service data for a specific customer return item that you must specify in the payload. You can use this operation by activating the business function ISR_RETAILSYSTEM.

parameters.name: CustomerReturnItem
parameters.description: Item number of the reference item

get.summary: Reads a specific line of a value-added service.
get.description: Reads a specific value-added service data using customer return ID, item number, value-added service type, and value-added subservice type. You can use this operation by activating the business function ISR_RETAILSYSTEM.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.summary: Updates a specific value-added service of a customer return item.
patch.description: Updates the data of a specific value-added service item using customer return ID, item number, value-added service type, and value-added subservice type. You can use this operation by activating the business function ISR_RETAILSYSTEM.

delete.summary: Deletes a specific value-added service of a customer return item.
delete.description: Deletes the data of a specific value-added service item using customer return ID, item number, value-added service type, and value-added subservice type. You can use this operation by activating the business function ISR_RETAILSYSTEM.

post.description: Rejects the approval request for a specific customer return. Consumer must pass the customer return number.

parameters.name: CustomerReturn
parameters.description: Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes

post.description: Releases the approval request for a specific customer return. Consumer must pass the customer return number.

parameters.name: CustomerReturn
parameters.description: Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes

post.description:
Group multiple requests into a single request payload, see [Batch Requests](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=152).

*Please note that "Try it out" is not supported for this request.*

multipart/mixed;boundary=request-separat.example:
--request-separator
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

GET A_CustomerReturn HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json


--request-separator--

multipart/mixed.example:
--response-separator
Content-Type: application/http

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{...}
--response-separator--
